column1: Auburn has the personnel and facilities necessary to complete the Project.  Auburn will undertake the Project through its Department of: ***. Auburn's Principal Investigator for the Project is: ***.
UNIVERSITY shall use its best efforts to ensure that there are no changes in the person of the project director.
column2: The word "best" has legal implications in contract law. A court could hold that a party subject to an efforts provision was obligated to make efforts out of proportion to the benefits to it under the contract in question.

column1: Where changes occur or are requested by SPONSOR, UNIVERSITY will promptly submit the name and qualification of any planned replacement of the project director whereupon SPONSOR shall, at its sole discretion, approve or reject any such replacement within a reasonable time. If a mutually acceptable replacement is not available SPONSOR may terminate the Agreement by giving thirty days (30) written notice.
column2: Auburn should have sole responsibility and choice of personnel replacements in contracts.
column3: Understanding a Sponsor's desire to have the PI of their choice running the project (often it’s the PI's reputation that brought them here in the first place), try to get the language, "Such approval shall not be unreasonably withheld" added.
